item.title: Report X-2025070008
item.description:
Report X-2025070008

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-30
  • City: LAS VEGAS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Operations Supervisor II Reese Harvey contacted safety to report a Hazardous Spill. Reese stated they were attempted to unload trailer 84597 when they noticed a pallet containing 1-gallon pails of UN1133, Adhesives containing a flammable liquid, 3, PG I was leaking. Reese stated a heavy pallet was l oaded on top of the pallet containing the 1-gallon pails of UN1133 and 2 of the pails were crushed under the weight resulting in a 16-oz spillage onto the pallet and trailer floor. Reese stated that no storm drains or waterways were impacted by the release. Safety contacted CURA and spoke with Becca Doris for remediation. ~

item.title: Report E-2025070376
item.description:
Report E-2025070376

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-12
  • City: LAS VEGAS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1138 ET, XPO-UVG notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 1 teaspoon of Trufuel 50:1 released from metal pail due to improper loading (the strap ripped the box). The release impacted just the box and pallet it came on. Lucas informed ERTS that this was already cleaned up and placed into a poly drum.

item.title: Report E-2025060501
item.description:
Report E-2025060501

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-30
  • City: SPARKS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Clean Harbors responded to the ESTES terminal and observed approximately 1 gallon of “Kem 400 Gloss Midnight Black” UN1263 released from one (1) damaged 55-gallon metal drum. The release impacted a 3ft-by-3ft area of trailer floor. Clean Harbors deployed granular absorbents. The contractor overpacked the damage drum into one 85-gallon overpack and the impacted absorbents with one 55-gallon metal drum. The contractor staged the generated waste onsite, and it will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025060000
item.description:
Report E-2025060000

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-05
  • City: AMARGOSA VALLEY
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: US ECOLOGY TRANSPORTATION SOLUTIONS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Employees were in the process of offloading drums that had been picked up from a household waste location in North Las Vegas. As an employee was attempting to place a drum onto a pallet it "exploded" and the lid and bolt ring struck an employeee's hands, forearms and head. Another employee had removed the drum from the trailer and according to him there was no evidence of bulging or other indication the contents were under pressure prior to the incident. The drum's contents included aersols and lighters, which the customer's employees should not have packaged together.
